IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To educate children from preschool to twelfth grade.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Waverly school is a nonsectarian, coeducational, college preparatory progressive day school that spans preschool through high school. Waverly is fully accredited by the Western Association of School and Colleges and the California Association of Independent Schools. The school promotes, confident, curious, resourceful learners who demonstrate intellectual engagement, critical and creative thinking, respect for individual differences, and a strong sense of personal and social responsibility.
IRS990.Desc: The Waverly School is a non-profit, educational institution, serving children from preschool through twelfth grade. The current whole school enrollment is 359 students. Families who chose The Waverly School come from diverse backgrounds in terms of their ethnicity, culture, socioeconomic status, profession and educational attainment level.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Waverly is exempt from taxation under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3) and California Revenue and Taxation Code Section 23701d. Generally accepted accounting principles provide accounting and disclosure guidance about positions taken by an organization in its tax returns that might be uncertain. Management has considered its tax positions and believes that all of the positions taken by Waverly in their federal and state exempt organization tax returns are more likely than not to be sustained upon examination. Waverly's returns are subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities, generally for three and four years, respectively, after they are filed.

The Waverly school celebrates diversity and fosters an atmosphere of mutual respect. The school seeks to reflect the diverse racial, ethnic, social and economic backgrounds of our community throughout all three schools. Families who choose The Waverly School for their children come from diverse backgrounds professionally, academically, socially, economically, racially and ethnically. The Student Non-Discriminatory Policy is published each year in the Los Angeles times; as well as in our admissions materials and on our Web site.

Consistent with our mission, Waverly's community is socioeconomically diverse. A full third of our students receive tuition assistance. We are committed to these students and their families, who are a vital part of our community. Tuition assistance is awarded on the basis of proven need and the availability of funds. Admissions decisions are need blind. Tuition Assistance applications are due no later than February 1st of each year in order to be considered.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Heidi Johnson, Head of School is married to Dan Bowen, High School History Teacher - Family relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors chooses new board members.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board's Treasurer is responsible for reviewing the draft information returns with the Head of School and the preparer prior to filing. A copy of the Form 990 is provided to all Board Members before filing. The Finance Committee reviews the return in detail at its next regularly scheduled meeting, either before or after filing. The Head of School signs the Form 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: At various board meetings throughout the year, conflict of interest is brought up and discussed. If any changes need to be made to the forms it is done at the meeting. New Trustees complete an extensive Board Orientation, including a Waverly Board Guidebook that further delineates how the Board discloses and manages possible or actual conflicts of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Head of School's (Chief Executive) compensation was determined by a review of the Board's Compensation Committee. The members of the committee were free of conflicts of interest and met the IRC requirements. The Head of School was not a member of the Committee and was not present for any of the committee discussions. The review was done using comparabliity data for similar organizations. This data was comprised of compensation information obtained via review of publicly available documents for Heads of School for non-profit schools in the San Gabriel Vallely and adjacent locations in the San Fernando Valley. The recommendations of the Compensation Committee were reviewed and approved by the Board of Directors in an Executive Session which exclulded the Head of School. The Head of School was not present for deliberations or for the vote. Contemporaneous documentation of the deliberation and decision was maintained as part of the Board's minutes of its executive session. 15(b) is marked NO as there are no key employees that meet the IRS definition.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, financial statements and tax returns are available upon request at the school during normal business hours.
